subtitle: paper 161 further discussions with rodon
on sunday september 25th 1829 the
apostles and the evangelist assembled at
megadon after a long conference that
evening with his associates
jesus surprised all by announcing that
early the next day he and the twelve
apostles would start for jerusalem
to attend the feast of tabernacles he
directed the evangelist visit the
believers in galilee
and at the women corps returned for a
while to bethesda
when the hour came to leave for
jerusalem nathanael and thomas were
still in the midst of their discussion
with rodan of alexandria
and they secured the master's permission
to remain at megadon for a few days
and so while jesus and the ten were on
their way to jerusalem
nathanael and thomas were engaged in
earnest debate with rodon
the week prior in which rodin had
expounded his philosophy
thomas and nathanael had alternated in
presenting the gospel of the kingdom to
the greek philosopher
radon discovered that he had been well
instructed in jesus teaching by one of
the former apostles
of john the baptist who had been his
teacher at alexandria

matter on which rodin and the two
apostles did not see alike
and that was the personality of god
rodan
readily accepted all that was presented
to him regarding the attributes of god
but he contended the father in heaven is
not cannot be
a person as man conceives personality
while the apostles found themselves in
difficult trying to prove that god is a
person
rhodan found it still more difficult to
prove he is not a person
rodin contended that the fact of
personality consists in the co-existent
fact
of full and mutual communication between
beings of equality
beings who are capable of sympathetic
and understanding
said radon in order to be a person
god must have symbols of spirit
communication which will enable him to
become fully understood by those who
make contact with him
but since god is infinite and eternal
the creator of all things
it follows that as regard being of
equality god is alone in the universe
there are none equal to him there are

equal
god indeed may be the source of all
personality
but as such he is transcendent to
personality
even as the creators above and beyond
the creature
this contention greatly troubled thomas
and nathanael and they had asked jesus
to come into their rescue
but the master refused to enter another
discussion he did say to thomas
it matters little what idea of the
father may entertain as long as you are

of his infinite and eternal nature
thomas contended that god does
communicate with man
and therefore that the father is a
person even within the definition of
rodan
this the greek rejected in the ground
that god does not reveal himself
personally
that he is still a mystery then
nathanael appealed to his own personal
experience with god
and that rodin allowed affirming that he
recently had similar experiences
but those experiences he contended
proved only the reality of god
and not his personality by monday night
thomas gave up but the tuesday night
nathaniel had won rodan
to believe in the personality of the
father and he affected this change in

1. the father in paradise does enjoy

the eternal son and the infinite spirit
in view of the doctrine of the trinity

it was the later consideration of these

of course it was the general belief that

two since jesus was equal with the
father
and since his son had achieved the

to his earth children such a phenomena
constituted proof
of the fact and demonstration of the

and forever settled the question
regarding the ability of god to
communicate
with man and the possibility of man's
communicating with
god three that jesus was on terms of

communication with man
that jesus was the son of god that the

and mutuality of sympathetic

time

insofar

that the personality of jesus

the two things which are related to the

transcending man's concept

always and universally a personality
five that god must be a personality
since he is the creator of all
personality
and the destiny of all personality

be therefore perfect even as your father

when rodin heard these arguments he said
i am convinced
i will confess god is a person if you
will permit me to qualify my confession

by attaching to the meaning of

such as superhuman transcendent supreme
infinite
eternal final and universal i am now

he cannot be anything less i am

and the satisfaction of all unsatisfied
factors in logic
reason and philosophy the divine nature

since nathanael and thomas had so fully
approved rodin's view of the gospel of
kingdom
there remained only one more point to
consider the teaching
dealing with the divine nature of jesus
a doctrine only so recently publicly
announced
nathanael and thomas jointly presented
their views of the divine nature of the
master
and the following narrative is condensed
rearranged and restated presentation of
their teaching
one jesus has admitted his divinity
and we believe him many remarkable
things have happened in connection with
his ministry
which we can understand only by
believing that he is the son of god as
well as a son of man
two his life association with us
exemplifies the ideal of human
friendship
only a divine being could possibly be
such a human friend
he is the most truly unselfish person we
have ever known
he is the friend of even sinners he
dares to love his enemies
he is very loyal to us while he does not
hesitate to approve us
it is plain to all that he truly loves
us the better you know him
the more you will love him you will be
charmed by his unswerving devotion
through all these years of our failure
to comprehend his mission he has been a
faithful friend
while he makes no use of flattery he
does treat us all with equal kindness
he is invariably tender and
compassionate he has shared his life and
everything else with us
we are a happy community we share all
things in common
we do not believe that a mere human
could live such a blameless life
under such trying circumstance
three we think jesus is divine because
he never does wrong
he makes no mistakes his wisdom is
extraordinary
his piety superb he lives day by day in
perfect accord with the father's will
he never repents of misdeeds because he
transgresses none of the father's law
he prays for us and with us but he never
asks us to pray for him
we believe that he is consistently
sinless we do not think that one is only
human ever professed to live such a life
he claims to live a perfect life and we
acknowledge that he does
our piety springs from repentance but
his piety springs from righteousness
he even professes to forgive sins and
does heal disease
no mere man would sanely profess to
forgive sin that is a divine prerogative
and he is seemed to be thus perfect in
his righteousness from the time of our
first contact with him
we grow in grace and in the kingdom of
the truth
but our master exhibits maturity of
righteousness to start with
all men good and evil recognize these
elements of goodness in jesus
and yet never is his piety obtrusive or
ostentatious
he is both meek and fearless he seems to
approve our belief in his divinity
he is either what he professes to be or
else he is the greatest hypocrite and
fraud the world has ever known
we are persuaded that he is just what he
claims to be
four the uniqueness of his character and
the perfection of his emotional control
convinces
that he is a combination of humanity and
divinity
he unfailingly responds to the spectacle
of human need
suffering never fails to appeal to him
his compassion is moved alive by
physical suffering
mental anguish or spiritual sorrow he is
quick to recognize and generous to

or any other grace in his fellow man he
is so
just and fair at the same time so

he grieves over the spiritual obstinacy
of the people and rejoices when they

five he seems to know the thoughts of
men's mind
and to understand the longing of their
hearts and he is always sympathetic with
our troubled spirits
he seems to possess all our human
emotions but they are magnificently
glorified
he strongly loves goodness and equally

he possesses a superhuman consciousness
of the presence of deity
he prays like a man but performs like a
god
he seems to foreign all things he even
now dares to speak about his death
some mystic reference to his future
glorification
while he is kind he's also brave and

six we are constantly impressed by the

hardly does a day pass but something
transpires to disclose
that the master knows what is going on
away from his immediate presence
he also seems to know about the thoughts
of associates
he undoubtedly has communion with
celestial personalities
he unquestionably lives on the spiritual

everything seems to be open to this
unique understanding
he asks us questions to draw us out not

seven recently the master does not
hesitate to assert his superhumanity
from the day of our ordination as

he has never denied that he came from
the father above
he speaks with the authority of a divine

day
and to declare the new gospel with

he is assertive positive and

he seems to be so sufficient within

he is indifferent to the opinions of men
he is brave and yet so free from pride
eight he constantly talks about god as

he goes about doing good for god seems

he makes the most astounding assertions

statements which would be absurd if you

he once declared before abraham was i

he professes to be in partnership with

he seems to be so sure about god and

nine in his prayer life he appears to

we have heard few of his prayers but

face to face he seems to know the future

he simply could not be all of this and

unless he were something more than human
we know he is human
we are sure of that but we are almost

we believe that he is divine we are

meganta he became a mighty man in the

he was a faithful believer to the end of

consciousness of divinity was a gradual

pre-human existence and universe
prerogatives
he seems to have possessed the power of

consciousness of his divinity
it appears to us that from his baptism

it was entirely optional with jesus
whether it depend
only on the human mind or to utilize the

at times he appeared to avail himself of
only that information
which was resonant in the human

as could be afforded only by the

will
self-limit his divinity consciousness we

that he was able to discern their

he did not desire too far to transcend

as it was held in the minds of his

we are utterly at a loss to

his divine consciousness and his

we are convinced that he used both of

we frequently observed him acting with

then would we behold him in conference

this is the limit of our knowledge of
